intro: Juniperus glaucescens, commonly known as the blue spruce, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to the western United States. It is characterized by its dense, blue-gray foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant has needle-like leaves that are typically 10–20 millimeters long and are arranged spirally around the branches. Its cones are small, woody, and typically mature within one year. Juniperus glaucescens is well adapted to cold climates and can thrive in a variety of soil types, making it a hardy and popular ornamental plant.
